rule: The output must consist of exactly four non-empty lines in the fixed order: Company names, People names, Specific topics, General themes.
testinput: Acme Corp invited Elena Ruiz to review quarterly earnings for Q2. The memo also referenced long-term business strategy and market positioning.
input: Acme Corp invited Elena Ruiz to review quarterly earnings for Q2. The memo also referenced long-term business strategy and market positioning.
output:
Company names: Acme Corp
People names: Elena Ruiz
Specific topics: Q2 earnings review, long-term business strategy, market positioning
General themes: Corporate finance, Strategic management, Market strategy
complianceText:
All required categories are present with comma-separated entries in correct format.
OK

rule: Each of the four lines must begin with the exact label followed by a colon and a single space, using the exact capitalization and spelling: "Company names: ", "People names: ", "Specific topics: ", and "General themes: ".
testinput: Globex and Northwind Traders held a joint briefing. Miguel Santos and Dr. Priya Shah debated supply chain delays and pricing strategy within international trade and retail operations.
input: Globex and Northwind Traders held a joint briefing. Miguel Santos and Dr. Priya Shah debated supply chain delays and pricing strategy within international trade and retail operations.
output:
Company names: Globex, Northwind Traders
People names: Miguel Santos, Dr. Priya Shah
Specific topics: supply chain delays, pricing strategy
General themes: international trade, retail operations
complianceText:
Format matches required headings and comma-separated lists.  
OK

rule: After the colon and space on each line, the content must be a comma-separated list of items where items are separated by a comma followed by a single space, with no trailing comma at the end of the line.
testinput: Product managers at ByteWorks coordinated with Contoso and GreenLeaf Organics. Aisha Khan, Jordan Lee, and Omar Patel discussed feature rollout, bug triage, and user onboarding to support software development and product management.
input: Product managers at ByteWorks coordinated with Contoso and GreenLeaf Organics. Aisha Khan, Jordan Lee, and Omar Patel discussed feature rollout, bug triage, and user onboarding to support software development and product management.
output:
Company names: ByteWorks, Contoso, GreenLeaf Organics
People names: Aisha Khan, Jordan Lee, Omar Patel
Specific topics: feature rollout, bug triage, user onboarding
General themes: software development, product management, cross-company coordination
complianceText:
It matches the required structure and format for entity extraction categories.  
OK

rule: Items in the lists must not contain commas themselves, because commas are reserved exclusively as separators between items in the lists.
testinput: Stellar Labs filed a new patent. Naomi Park prepared the application for a patent filing to strengthen the company’s intellectual property.
input: Stellar Labs filed a new patent. Naomi Park prepared the application for a patent filing to strengthen the company’s intellectual property.
output:
Company names: Stellar Labs
People names: Naomi Park
Specific topics: patent filing, patent application preparation, intellectual property protection
General themes: intellectual property management, corporate legal processes, innovation protection
complianceText:
Format matches desired categories, all four sections present, comma-separated lists used. Compliant.
OK

rule: Each item in any list must be a concise phrase and must not be a complete sentence, and no item may end with a period, question mark, or exclamation mark.
testinput: BlueRiver Bank tasked Carlos Mendes with reducing churn. The plan emphasizes customer retention and loyalty program design rather than writing long slogans. It ties into banking strategy.
input: BlueRiver Bank tasked Carlos Mendes with reducing churn. The plan emphasizes customer retention and loyalty program design rather than writing long slogans. It ties into banking strategy.
output:
Company names: BlueRiver Bank
People names: Carlos Mendes
Specific topics: reducing churn, customer retention, loyalty program design, banking strategy
General themes: customer loyalty, retention strategy, banking industry strategy, customer experience
complianceText:
Follows desired section order and comma-separated lists per specification.
OK

rule: No line may contain any text other than the required label, colon, single space, and the comma-separated list of items; the output must contain no explanations, headings, extra commentary, or echoed input text.
testinput: Subject: Orion Media Q4 update. Lila Gomez summarized ad inventory trends. Footer: This note is confidential. The broader topic relates to media economics.
input: Subject: Orion Media Q4 update. Lila Gomez summarized ad inventory trends. Footer: This note is confidential. The broader topic relates to media economics.

Format matches four categories with comma-separated lists as required.

rule: The output must not contain any placeholder symbols or angle-bracket notation, such as "<...>" or "-||-", and must present actual extracted items.
testinput: Draft notes: FinEdge met with Ravi Kumar about risk modeling. Remove placeholders like <TBD> and -||- before publication. The focus remains financial analytics.

rule: Company names are names of business entities mentioned in the input text (such as corporations, companies, firms, startups, or brands), and each company name listed must exactly match a company mention from the input text, allowing differences in letter case only.

rule: People names are names of individual human persons mentioned in the input text, and each listed person name must match a person mention from the input text and may include honorifics or titles (e.g., Mr., Ms., Dr., Prof.) only if they appear with the name in the input text.
testinput: EduVerse partnered with local colleges. Prof. Maria Silva and Mr. John Okoro reviewed curriculum design to modernize higher education.

rule: Specific topics are concrete, narrowly scoped subjects discussed in the input text, expressed as short noun phrases typically one to four words long, and must not include proper names of companies or people.
testinput: At DevForge, Hana Mori proposed unit testing, continuous integration, and code review standards. The initiative advances software engineering practices.
input: At DevForge, Hana Mori proposed unit testing, continuous integration, and code review standards. The initiative advances software engineering practices.
output:
Company names: DevForge
People names: Hana Mori
Specific topics: unit testing, continuous integration, code review standards
General themes: software engineering practices, code quality, development process, best practices

Provides all four fields in correct comma‐separated format matching description.
OK

rule: General themes are broad, overarching subject areas that summarize the content of the input text at a higher level of abstraction than the specific topics, expressed as short noun phrases typically one to five words long, and must not include proper names of companies or people.
testinput: MediPulse’s field team, led by Dr. Ahmed Salim, audited vaccine cold storage in clinics. The report connects tactics to public health and healthcare policy.

output:
Company names: MediPulse
People names: Dr. Ahmed Salim
Specific topics: vaccine cold storage, clinic auditing, cold chain management
General themes: public health, healthcare policy
complianceText:
Format correct; labels used properly and entries comma-separated as specified.  
OK

rule: No item listed under Specific topics may be identical to any item listed under General themes.
